data.title: Spacious brewery
data.text: Wife and I visited for the Billings Marathon and stopped by after being referred here by Uberbrew.  I probably would have liked this place more had I not been to under tee first.  These beers were all hoppy which is not my particular taste.

data.title: Fun place
data.text: Love angry hanks! It's a great place to grab a couple of brews and hangout with friends!!! Love the beer selection and the popcorn!

data.title: Passing Through
data.text: Beer was very yummy.  Sat on patio and had popcorn with beer.  Very casual.  Could have stayed longer to enjoy more beer.

data.title: Great beer
data.text: Don't miss this place if you're in Billings.  The beer is very very nice. Trip Advisor wants me to say more, but I don't know what else to add--great beer here.

data.title: Second stop on Billings brew walk
data.text:
So another stop that the strict brewery laws of Montana are hurting...no food so only 4 stars....
You know you're in a good spot when there's a line and everyone in line is enjoying eachothers company and they know eachothers names (or that just means theres a lot of drunks in Montana...nahhh...)  No flight option, which i frown apon, give me options to enjoy your beers but not get drunk.  So, choices, what do I choose...Belgian wheat,  dunkle Weizen, Brown ale...(there are the IPA'S for you trendsetters)  Damn scottish ale is sold out!!  I go with my fav..Russian Imperial Stout-Dark, coffee, vanilla, creamy smells hit your nose right away.  Very smooth, more vanilla chocolate than coffee.  Light on the belly and on the bitters.  If i could only taste more of them but i do plan to hit the other 4 breweries and this imperial is a whopping 8.4 abv!  Only one my friends!!!  Drink to enjoy and taste, not to get drunk!!

data.title: Fun selection
data.text:
Enjoyed the Dog Slobber and Blonda Ale

Great selection of craft brews

Be aware - limited hours and 3 pints per person per day

data.title: Excellent brewery, and the price is right
data.text: My wife and I stopped in here after a long drive up from Denver, and we're very glad we did. Their line up is solid; I had the Head Trauma IPA after sampling a couple others. They have free popcorn with a variety of toppings, otherwise no other food options. The inside is a little spartan but if you want a quality $3 craft beer or a growler to take home, this is a great choice.

data.title: Exceptional beer!
data.text: This is a great place afterwork to have a great brew and to unwind.  It is not fancy.  The patio is nice (May).   We enjoyed the Russian stout and the amber ale.   Closes at 8.  Popcorn is the food but if you are looking for a great pint- this is it!!!  Lines move quickly so do not let that scare you away.  Can take beer home from here.

data.title: Best brewery in Billings!
data.text: Angry Hank's is THE best brewery in Billings.  From their Street Fight Red Ale (which is featured by MANY restaurants in Billings) to their Anger Management, they consistently have the best tasting beer in town.  Their new taproom is open until 8pm, and each person can have up to 3 beers each.  Great spot to meet up before a dinner downtown!

data.title: No frills, good brews
data.text: Good brews with enough choices for everyone.  Servers were curt and not helpful with questions asked.  Pricing is great and free popcorn.

data.title: Beer & (free) Popcorn :-)
data.text: Stopped here on our walking tour of the breweries in Billings.  Popular spot a little "off the beaten path" away from the center of downtown.  We were lucky to find a table and a fast-moving line to the bar.  Had the Anger Management, which was a very light tasting beer... not quite as flavorful as some other local brews but still good nonetheless.  And don't forget the popcorn!  For people just visiting Billings & MT, you can only get 3 drinks per visit - tallied on a wrist band - so either drink real slow or plan on walking to another place for dinner and more beer.

data.title: Micro brew at its BEST
data.text:
I am not a big drinker but enjoy a brew once and awhile. Usually enjoy a darker beer and Hanks Street fight is my 
favorite beer of all time. Nice place gets really crowded at times but that's just the way it is in Billings on weekends.

data.title: Hometown Feel
data.text: The Original Hanks is my favorite with a home town feel. Great service, friendly patrons, and great root beer.

data.title: Consider skipping this one
data.text: First place I have been to which presents itself as a craft brewery but then only sells it by the pint, no samples or tasters (and I have been to a large number of craft breweries in a number of western states). Thus if you want to go to a popular bar to drink this may be for you. However, if you want to go to a craft brewery to sample or taste several different beers then skip Angry Hanks. Girl at the bar acted like I was asking for something strange when I asked about samples or rasters.

data.title: Best place for a great beer in the Billings, MT area...
data.text: I'm a wine drinker and educator, that being said, I love going to Angry Hank's whenever I'm in Billings.  They have a great concept and quality microbrews. And don't forget to throw some hot sauce on your popcorn!

data.title: Great Beer and Atmosphere
data.text: You owe it to you self to stop in a have a pint or two. I was in town for a friends wedding and we came here to stater off the night and almost didn't leave.  Street Fight and Pastey White Boy were our favorites that evening but there are many more to try. Don't miss this one.

data.title: The best.
data.text:
Angry Hank's has the BEST BEER in town. I've come to a point where I don't drink commercial beer anymore; it's like eating at McDonald's. Microbrews are the way to go. There is a very, very big difference. Budweiser, Coors, and others simply taste like swill.
The only problem that I see at Angry Hank's is that they don't serve any food. However, you can step out and bring in pizza or chinese;

data.title: Unique Taproom
data.text: Awesome Taproom in the middle of downtown Billings. The converted  auto garage into taproom was cool. Sat outside and enjoyed a Street Fight Imperial Red Ale. They had a nice selection to choose from but the only downside is you can only have 3 ~ or I would have stayed until they closed!!!! Awesome joint!

data.title: Relaxed, fun atmosphere!
data.text: Stopped by this garage renovated into a brew pub!  Great brew, fun place, nice people,  and cheap!  We had fun, and indoor and outdoor seating!

data.title: Unique setting, friendly and good!
data.text: We went to the downtown taproom which is located in an old oil change building which has a lot of character!  They have attached an outdoor patio for those wishing to drink their cold beer in the sun!  They are very friendly and their beer is good.  The number of people coming and going to fill up their growlers is a testament to that!
